alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Dorchester; Inland Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON, COLLETON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 1043 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Walterboro to near Cottageville to near Knightsville, and moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Summerville, Walterboro, Givhans Ferry State Park, Ravenel, Ridgeville, Meggett, and Cottageville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify. Be certain to monitor local radio and TV stations as well as local cable TV outlets for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
